Pre-Game Insights: The Astros are 41-30 at home and 77-66 overall, with a strong on-base percentage (.321). The Athletics are 62-82 overall and 26-43 on the road, with struggles when allowing home runs. The teams meet for the 11th time this season, with the Astros leading 7-3 in the season series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game is the first of a three-game series in Houston. The Astros have a 6-4 record and a.263 batting average in their last 10 games, outscoring opponents by 10 runs. The Athletics have a 4-6 record, a.249 batting average, and a 4.73 ERA in their last 10 games, being outscored by 17 runs.
Others: Key performers include Yordan Alvarez (31 doubles, 32 home runs) and Mauricio Dubon (13-for-28 in last 10 games) for the Astros; Brent Rooker (35 home runs,.583 slugging percentage) and Shea Langeliers (11-for-41, 3 home runs in last 10 games) for the Athletics. Both teams have several players on the 60-day IL due to injuries.
